title: Tech company Limitless unveils Broken India Instagram campaign
text:
56 shares 1

comments
While social media has been brilliant for opening people's eyes to issues, users of sites like Instagram have also been guilty of focusing on what makes a beautiful photo instead of documenting the realities.
A new Indian tech company based in Singapore called Limitless has now released a collection of images based around this concept, which they called Broken India.
Instead of the #beautifulindia photos that people share on social media, they have created a series of pictures that show a glamorous Instagram picture, as well as the often less attractive surrounds that are regularly cropped out.
A spokesperson for the company told Buzzfeed : 'While we have 5-star hotels on one side, we have slums on the other. While children are seen as the future of the country, theyâ€™re also forced into child labour.
'While there has been both positive and negative response, we feel that we have achieved what we wanted, sending out a message to the audience indicating the state of affairs of the country.'
Read on to see the images from the Broken India collection...
In this image, a young girl beams for the camera, but the cropped-out area surrounding the Instagram picture shows that she is sifting among rubbish
In this picture, a beautiful temple features on Instagram, but in the unseen background there is a litter-strewn river bank next to where people are bathing
Here, an Instagram shot zooms in on a sail boat, not taking into account the man sitting among a heavily-littered river bank
Indian slums have been cropped out of this picture, which zooms in on a modern tower block in the distance
A close-up of a yellow taxi neglects to show the crumbling building and hazardous tangle of wires in the background
In this picture, a woman smiles for the camera, but the beach she is standing on has been removed from view
In this picture, a herd of adorable-looking cows are cropped out of a shot of the sunset
